title: Frontex to probe Bulgarian police for keeping migrants in cage
description: An investigation by 'Le Monde', Lighthouse Reports, and several news outlets revealed that migrants were held in a cage before the eyes of EU border agents.

title: Germany tackles its violent and rebellious far right
description: Twenty-five people involved in an attempted coup were arrested in Germany on Wednesday, confirming the presence of a radicalized conspiracy movement.

title: On Twitter, 'Elon Musk is getting a hard lesson in content moderation'
description: Claiming to be a 'free speech absolutist,' the new boss of the social media platform has already started suspending content that is problematic but not necessarily illegal.

title: France makes condoms free for young adults
description: Announcing this development for young people aged 18 to 25, the French president described it as 'a small revolution for contraception.'

title: French think-tank chief convicted for drugging his former sister-in-law
description: Laurent Bigorgne, a close associate of the French president, was sentenced to a 12-month suspended prison term for spiking his former sister-in-law's drink at a dinner in his home.

title: As the French worry about possible power cuts, Macron tries to keep up morale
description: Faced with the risk of load shedding in January, the government is fumbling over how to handle the potential power cuts, afraid of sparking panic.

title: Macron slams  TikTok over 'addiction' and censorship
description: TikTok, which is owned by Beijing-based tech giant ByteDance, is used by over 1 billion people worldwide every month.

title: French MP in hot water after drunkenly disrupting theater performance
description: Green politician Aurélien  Taché was mocked by MPs from opposing parties after being called out on Twitter by the play's director.

title: US Congress passes bill protecting same-sex and interracial marriage
description: The law would require states to recognize all marriages, in case the Supreme Court decision allowing same-sex marriage was ever overturned.

title: New York Times journalists begin first mass strike  in 40 years
description: Hundreds of journalists at this media institution say they are stopping work in protest at management’s failure to reach deal on new contract.

title: Céline Dion cancels European tour after rare neurological disorder diagnosis
description: The Canadian singer told her fans on Instagram she had been diagnosed with "stiff-person syndrome" which affects her vocal cords

title: French court upholds life sentence for Amsterdam-Paris train attacker
description: The appeals court upheld a life sentence for a terrorist who in August 2015 opened fire aboard a high-speed train bound for Paris.

title: Genghis Khan exhibition defies Chinese censorship at Nantes history museum
description: The exhibition dedicated to the founder of the Mongol Empire was canceled due to Beijing's intervention in 2020, but will return in another form in October 2023.

title: Sweden launches hunt for undocumented migrants
description: The government, backed by the far right, is considering identity checks including DNA testing and the obligation for public sector employees to report illegal immigrants.

title: Bayer ordered to pay minimal compensation to farmer poisoned by Monsanto herbicide
description: After a years-long legal battle delayed by appeals, French farmer Paul François will receive only €11,135.

title: US basketball star Brittney Griner freed in US-Russia prisoner  swap
description: After being imprisoned in Russia on drug charges, US officials say the two-time Olympic gold medalist has been freed in a prisoner swap.

title: Luis de la Fuente replaces Luis Enrique as Spain football coach
description: The announcement follows Spain's World Cup elimination after a disappointing loss to Morocco.

title: Former Guatemalan president Otto Perez sentenced to 16 years in jail for corruption
description: The former general was found guilty of racketeering and fraud targeting the country's customs system as part of a scheme known as 'The Line.'

title: World Cup 2022: England's Raheem Sterling to return to Qatar after home break-in
description: The Chelsea forward missed the last match after his home in England was broken into by burglars.

title: Trump the serial loser
description: The former president is facing unfavorable court decisions, the Trump Organization's tax fraud conviction and fallout from a controversial dinner with Kanye West.

title: Lawsuits mount against TotalEnergies over role in climate change
description: Despite pledges to become carbon neutral in 2050, the French oil company is still devoting more than 70% of its investments to fossil energies.

title: Small-scale Bordeaux winegrowers protest for more government support
description: Suffering the consequences of a major overproduction crisis, winegrowers held a protest on December 6 in Bordeaux, the capital of the Gironde department.

title: Iran carries out first known execution over Amini protests
description: Mohsen Shekari was executed on Thursday, after he allegedly blocked a street in Tehran during Iran's nationwide demonstrations.

title: European Commission proposes strengthening rights of children from same-sex families
description: The EU's executive branch wants to introduce a European Certificate of Parenthood valid throughout the European Union for families in cross-border situations.

title: Refugees held in cage on EU's border as Frontex agents watched
description: 'Le Monde', Lighthouse Reports and several European news outlets reveal video evidence of Bulgarian border guards illegally detaining refugees in a cage, under the watchful eye of Europe's border force agency Frontex.

title: Antonio Recalcati, Italian painter who never shied away from political art, has died
description: The self-taught artist's body of work is marked by a desire to condemn imperialism and American capitalism. He died on December 4 in Milan at the age of 84.

title: UK airport staff plan Christmas walkout, joining strike wave
description: British airport passport officers are the latest profession to threaten a December strike.

title: Lyon's Festival of Lights kicks off, seeking to mitigate energy costs
description: The event, which takes place this year until December 11, 2022, will run on low voltage as France's second-largest city is keen to demonstrate it acts responsibly.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Benjamin Pavard is certainly fed up with playing out of position and being a scapegoat'
description: The hero of France-Argentina at the 2018 World Cup is now playing second fiddle in Les Bleus. His performance during the first group match against Australia made him lose his place

title: Theranos executive Ramesh Balwani sentenced to nearly 13 years in prison
description: Mr. Balwani, Elizabeth Holmes' former lover and accomplice, received a slightly longer sentence than that given to the CEO for his role in the comany's blood-test hoax.

title: 'Playing spot the difference between the French and British economies reveals their parallel decline'
description: The two countries love to compare themselves, but the real lesson is that their economies are both in decline, writes London correspondent Eric Albert.

title: World Cup 2022: Faced with the Mbappé threat, England will rely on Walker
description: Since the start of the World Cup in Qatar, the French striker has been scoring and spreading fear among opponents. But the English believe that their right back's speed will be enough to counter the tournament's top scorer.

title: TotalEnergies back in court over its mega-project in Uganda
description: Friends of the Earth, Survie and four Ugandan NGOs accuse the oil company of breaking the French duty of vigilance law for failing to prevent risks to human safety, human rights and the environment.

title: Isabella Tree on biodiversity: 'We need a variety of species but also an abundance of life'
description: In 20 years, Isabella Tree and her husband have transformed their English estate, where they practiced intensive agriculture, into an exceptional haven for animal and plant species. She talks about their approach in an interview with 'Le Monde'.

title: COP15 on biodiversity aims to protect 30% of the planet, as some wonder about remaining 70%
description: A draft agreement in negotiation at the UN Biodiversity Conference held in Montreal, Canada, calls for an increase in the size of protected areas.

title: In Paris, Niger convinces investors to finance its economic and social development plan
description: The undertaking marks a sign of the interest in the country, which plans to pump 110,000 oil barrels a day by 2023, compared to the current 20,000, in hopes of boosting growth and lowering the poverty rate.

title: Latvia revokes license of exiled Russian TV channel Dojd
description: Riga said the channel posed a 'threat to national security' for airing messages in support of Moscow. The decision was denounced by Reporters Without Borders.
